TopicTitle: What Are Things You've Heard That Made You Facepalm?

Articles.Content:
Twitter:

60% of People in this world are dumb, and I am in the other 30%.

I want my first Daughter to be a girl!

Happy 2013 Birthday America!

This amazing world is now 2014 years old. Incredible.

![DO4eNdx.png](http://i.imgur.com/DO4eNdx.png)

*why am I seeing this*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-19T16:16:33Z" title="08/19/2015 04:16  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 19, 2015</time> by windows\_x\_seven**

Doing a math assignment, noticed this question.

> 
> Find the value of x that satisfies the expression 2x^0+x^(1/3) when x=125.

My friends and I are debating whether this is a trick question.
Author most likely just copy pasted from a wrong line.

> 
> Never go to the comments section. For any subject.

Unless its on the KSP forum.

> 
> Unless its on the KSP forum.

I think Red Iron Crown meant Youtube comments, though I'm not 100% sure.

[**"NASA Orion spacecraft may make interstellar space travel reality"**](http://www.techtimes.com/articles/19175/20141101/nasa-orion-spacecraft-may-make-interstellar-space-travel-reality.htm)

\*post talks about getting to Mars\*

**Ok.** (Fictional thumbs-up) Dis is gud.

The fact that they associated Orion with interstellar travel is already facepalm worthy, but saying that going to Mars is an interstellar travel... ugh.

My science teacher last year said if the sun was blue the Earth would freeze due to having a cold star. 

\*repeated facepalms with my book\*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-26T23:27:22Z" title="08/26/2015 11:27  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 26, 2015</time> by Voyager275**

> 
> My science teacher last year said if the sun was blue the Earth would freeze due to having a cold star. 
> \*repeated facepalms with my book\*

How does one be a science teacher AND still be able say that?

> 
> I think Red Iron Crown meant Youtube comments, though I'm not 100% sure.

"You see, Simba, everything the light touches is our home."

"But what about that shadowy place?"

"That is the YouTube comments section. You must never go there."

> The fact that they associated Orion with interstellar travel is already facepalm worthy, but saying that going to Mars is an interstellar travel... ugh.

The fact that they think Orion will actually get us to Mars is facepalm worthy. yes i said it

> 
> The fact that they associated Orion with interstellar travel is already facepalm worthy...

Well, there is this:

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Orion_%28nuclear_propulsion%29](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Orion_%28nuclear_propulsion%29)

> 
> Well, there is this:
> [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Orion_%28nuclear_propulsion%29](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Orion_%28nuclear_propulsion%29)

Orion, as in, the spacecraft.

Not the engine.

> 
> Orion, as in, the spacecraft.
> Not the engine.

"Project Orion was a study of a spacecraft..."

The article makes it clear that Orion was used as the name of the type of ships using the propulsion method, not just the propulsion method itself.

> 
> How does one be a science teacher AND still be able say that?

He said many stupid things. Like the earth always has the same amount of materials since its formation

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-26T23:26:01Z" title="08/26/2015 11:26  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 26, 2015</time> by Voyager275**

> 
> "Project Orion was a study of a spacecraft..."
> The article makes it clear that Orion was used as the name of the type of ships using the propulsion method, not just the propulsion method itself.

Either way **he** was referring to the **article that said Orion and meant the Mars craft.**

> 
> Either way **he** was referring to the **article that said Orion and meant the Mars craft.**

True. However, there is a reasonable explanation why someone would connect "Orion" and "interstellar spacecraft".

> 
> True. However, there is a reasonable explanation why someone would connect "Orion" and "interstellar spacecraft".

He did put an image of the Orion spacecraft in his article, and the article's title had "NASA Orion **Spacecraft**" written on it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-20T01:15:55Z" title="08/20/2015 01:15  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 20, 2015</time> by windows\_x\_seven**

> 
> He did put an image of the Orion spacecraft in his article, and the article's title had "NASA Orion **Spacecraft**" written on it.

Yes yes. I *know*.

*Edit:*

Point being that there was at one time a **spacecraft** in consideration called Orion, that was a possibility for an interstellar design. The words "interstellar" and "Orion" and "**spacecraft**" are linked in some manner. Much more closely linked than say "flat" and "earth", for example.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-20T01:39:40Z" title="08/20/2015 01:39  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 20, 2015</time> by razark**

My wife's coworker was using the printer/copier/fax machine, and my wife was going to use the phone. Coworker says:

"You can't use the phone while I'm doing this"

Wife: "Are you sending a fax?"

CW: "No, making a copy"

Wife: "Then i can use the phone"

CW: "I dunno, I guess...."

My wife had a much-needed good laugh, and kept chuckliing about it all day.

> 
> My wife's coworker was using the printer/copier/fax machine, and my wife was going to use the phone. Coworker says:
> "You can't use the phone while I'm doing this"
> 
> Wife: "Are you sending a fax?"
> 
> CW: "No, making a copy"
> 
> Wife: "Then i can use the phone"
> 
> CW: "I dunno, I guess...."
> 
> My wife had a much-needed good laugh, and kept chuckliing about it all day.

Also, the fax machine might be on a separate phone line. Double the facepalm if true.

> 
> Holy....
> My ears hurt from the shear amount of the F-word that this kid used. Like seriously, he can't be older than 12. His voice cracks when he swears. XD
> 
> I can't even. "Zelda is a ripoff of \*\*\*\* minecraft. Wanna know why, you \*\*\*\* \*\*\*\*? What do you do in \*\*\*\* Zelda? You \*\*\*\* swing a \*\*\*\* sword around. JUST LIKE IN \*\*\*\* MINECRAFT. and you go around, and kill \*\*\*\* monsters, and \*\*\*\* explore worlds. And where have I seen this before? Oh yeah, \*\*\*\* MINECRAFT!!!" 
> 
> He had to take a breather every 2 minutes from all the screaming and swearing.
> 
>  to mods, all swear words were replaced by \*\*\*\*, with no first letter or correct number of characters, that way it isn't obvious what he said, and anyone who doesn't know swear words won't be able to tell what it is at all.

I actually had a field time watching him scream. It was indeed.. entertaining.

> 
> As a piano player and lover of bothe Beethoven and Mozart (mostly Beethoven) this makes me sad.

The worse part is that when I told him that it was Beethoven's 5th Symphony, he said both of them were the same anyways. (I'm not even kidding.)

I mean, how do you mistake an old, deaf and formal composer as a 1790's adult with the hairstyle of a Supreme Court judge?!

Actually it has been proven that Super Minecraft Kid, PhD, is nothing but a satire of Minecraft and FNAF d

fans.

> 
> Actually it has been proven that Super Minecraft Kid, PhD, is nothing but a satire of Minecraft and FNAF d
> fans.

Nibirupedia, I lost it.
